newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Sept rubber output for tyres up 4.5% yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Japan Sept rubber output for tyres up 4.5% yr/yr.

text.p: Japanese rubber output for tyres totalled 93,842 tonnes in September, up 4.5 percent from the same period last year and up 23.8 percent from August, the Japan Automobile Tyre Manufacturers' Association said on Wednesday.
Domestic rubber shipments in September amounted to 60,472 tonnes, up five percent from the previous year and up 25 percent from the same month a year earlier, the industry body said.
Japan's exports of rubber for tyres in September totalled 34,332 tonnes, up 5.3 percent from the same period a year earlier, and up six percent from August, it said.
"Exports especially to Asia and the Middle East continued to be strong, and rubber output for new cars showed signs of improving," an official of the industry body said.
Japan's rubber output for tyres in the first nine months of this year totalled 793,145 tonnes, up 3.6 percent from the same period a year earlier.
Japan's rubber output for tyres for this calendar year is expected to hit a record high, the industry official said.
